column2: unde veniet auxilium mihī. ^ I have lifted up my eyes to the mountains
column3: from whence help shall come to me.

column2: quī fēcit caelum et terram. ^ My help is from the Lord

column1: 3 ^ Nōn det in commōtiōnem pedem tuum
column2: neque dormītet quī custōdit tē. ^ May he not suffer thy foot to be moved
column3: neither let him slumber that keepeth thee.

column1: 4 ^ Ecce nōn dormītābit neque dormiet quī custōdit Isrāēlem. ^ Behold he shall neither slumber nor sleep that keepeth Israel.

column2: Dominus prōtectiō tua super manum dexteram tuam. ^ The Lord is thy keeper
column3: the Lord is thy protection upon thy right hand.

column1: 6 ^ Per diem sōl nōn ūret tē
column2: neque lūna per noctem. ^ The sun shall not burn thee by day

column1: 7 ^ Dominus custōdit tē ab omnī malō; custōdiat animam tuam Dominus. ^ The Lord keepeth thee from all evil; may the Lord keep thy soul.

column4: et usque in saeculum. ^ May the Lord keep thy coming in and thy going out
column5: from henceforth now and for ever.
